paper_metadata.title: Analysis of National Poverty Alleviation Policy Effect on Economic Development in the New Period

program_information.program_name: National Program for Rural Poverty Alleviation (2001-2010)

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: poverty alleviation funds were applied for water, electricity, roads and other infrastructure construction; culture, education and other public welfare services; planting, breeding and other productive projects

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The results show that GDP in non-poverty area is varied from 84% to 65.7%, higher than poverty area
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: the influence of national poverty alleviation policy on economic development in the new period was analyzed by the method of difference in difference

bonus_information.cost_mentions: special funds for poverty alleviation reached 182.386 billion, maintaining the growth rate of 11.7 percent a year
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: From 2001 to 2010, the special funds for poverty alleviation reached 182.386 billion, maintaining the growth rate of 11.7 percent a year

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: the state again issued the "National Program for Rural Poverty Alleviation (2001-2010)"
evidence_citations.country_citation: China's poverty-relief work has entered a new period
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: this plan identified 592 poor counties in order to solve the problem of food and clothing of 80 million poor people
